content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    code_blocks = findall(r"^```.*\n", md)
    cleaned_code_blocks = [replace(code_block, r"^```", "", 1) for code_block in code_blocks]
    return join(cleaned_code_blocks, "\n")
end
```
The function `extract_julia_code` takes in a string `md` containing markdown formatted text with Julia code blocks. It extracts all the code blocks using regular expression matching and finds the start of each block (`r"^```.*\n"`) and the end of each block (`r"\n$"`). The function then removes the code fences from each block using `replace(code_block, r"^```", "", 1)`. Finally, it joins all the cleaned code blocks together with a newline character `\n` and returns the result.
